subject: Re: [junit] Help w/"JUnit Best Practices" Program from JavaWorld
msgSnippet: ... I just downloaded this and tried it out. I get that message when my classpath is incomplete.  It s unfortunate that the bp package doesn t name the class
messageBody:
On Thu, 1 Mar 2001 judy.dobry@... wrote:

> Hi,
>
> The December, 2000 edition of JavaWorld featured an article on
> JUnit Best Practices
> (http://www.javaworld.com/javaworld/jw-12-2000/jw-1221-junit.html).
> This article includes a program that builds a JUnit test case for an
> entire system.
>
> I've tried running this program using the instructions in the article
> but I get the message: "Cannot load class that NameOfMyClass is
> dependent on" for all of my classes. Some of the classes should not
> be loaded because they are not valid test cases. But there are some
> classes that should be loaded and I am puzzled as to why the program
> will not load them.
>
> My valid test classes contain the required line:
> public static final String TEST_ALL_TEST_TYPE = "UNIT";
>
> Any suggestions would be much appreciated.

I just downloaded this and tried it out.

I get that message when my classpath is incomplete. It's unfortunate
that the bp package doesn't name the class it couldn't load. Basically,
that bp classpath should contain everything your own applcation's classpath
contains, in addition to junit and bp itself.

--
Joi Ellis Software Engineer
Aravox Technologies joi@..., gyles19@...

No matter what we think of Linux versus FreeBSD, etc., the one thing I
really like about Linux is that it has Microsoft worried. Anything
that kicks a monopoly in the pants has got to be good for something.
- Chris Johnson
